001import javax.swing.JFrame;
002import javax.swing.JComponent;
003import javax.swing.JPanel;
004import javax.swing.JLabel;
005import javax.swing.JButton;
006import javax.swing.ImageIcon;
007
008import java.awt.BorderLayout;
009import java.awt.GridBagLayout;
010import java.awt.GridBagConstraints;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013import java.awt.Font;
014import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
015import java.awt.Insets;
016
017import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
018import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
019/** GameFrame.java - A class to generate game window and handle GUI
020* This class contains a GUI per requirement f. in project specifications
021* This class also uses Polymorphism when adding and subtracting game elements
022*       per requirement b. in project specifications
023* @author Daniel Andrews
024* @version Final Project
025*/
026public class GameFrame extends JFrame {
027        private static final String TITLE = "Asteroids"; // Window title should always be "Asteroids"
028        
029        private JPanel gamePanel, // Declare game and menu panels and give scope to class
030                                   menuPanel;
031        
032        private JLabel scoreLabel, // Declare labels to display score, lives, menu title, and highscore
033                                   livesLabel,
034                                   menuTitleLabel,
035                                   menuScoreLabel;
036
037        private ImageIcon startButtonImage, // Declare ImageIcons to be assigned to menu buttons
038                                          exitButtonImage;
039
040        /** Constructor initializes JFrame attributes and retrieves images from game controller
041        */
042        public GameFrame() {
043                setSize(Asteroids.CANVAS_WIDTH, Asteroids.CANVAS_HEIGHT); // Set frame dimensions for game
044                setTitle(TITLE); // Set game title
045                setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE); // Set default operation upon close button
046                setLocationRelativeTo(null); // Center on screen
047                setResizable(false);
048                startButtonImage = Asteroids.gc.getStartButtonImage(); // Initialize button sprites with
049                exitButtonImage = Asteroids.gc.getExitButtonImage();   // corresponding button images
050        }
051
052        /** Setup window to display main menu
053        * @param highscore Highscore to be displayed on main menu
054        */
055        public void goToMenu(int highscore) {
056                menuPanel = new JPanel(); // Initialize panel
057                menuPanel.setLayout(new GridBagLayout()); // Use GridBagLayout to control element position
058                menuPanel.setBackground(Color.BLACK); // Set background color to the empty black void of space
059
060                GridBagConstraints constraints = new GridBagConstraints(); // Initialize constraints object for layout
061
062                // Set constraints and attributes then add to menu panel
063                constraints.gridx = 0; // Set component grid location in layout
064                constraints.gridy = 1;
065                constraints.insets = new Insets(10, 10, 0, 10); // Set buffer for component
066                menuTitleLabel = new JLabel(); // Make new label for title
067                menuTitleLabel.setForeground(Color.WHITE); // Set label to display in white
068                menuTitleLabel.setFont(new Font("Courier", Font.PLAIN, 50)); // Set label font to courier for that sweet, retro feel
069                menuTitleLabel.setText("ASTEROIDS"); // Set label text
070                menuPanel.add(menuTitleLabel, constraints); // Add to label with defined constraints
071
072                // Set constraints and attributes then add to menu panel
073                constraints.gridx = 0; 
074                constraints.gridy = 2;
075                constraints.insets = new Insets(0, 10, 15, 10); 
076                menuScoreLabel = new JLabel(); 
077                menuScoreLabel.setForeground(Color.WHITE); 
078                menuScoreLabel.setFont(new Font("Courier", Font.PLAIN, 14));
079                menuScoreLabel.setText("High Score: " + highscore); 
080                menuPanel.add(menuScoreLabel, constraints); 
081                
082                // Set constraints and attributes then add to menu panel
083                constraints.gridx = 0; 
084                constraints.gridy = 3;
085                constraints.insets = new Insets(10, 10, 25, 10);
086                JButton startButton = new JButton(startButtonImage); // JButton to start game using preloaded image
087                // Set action to be performed upon click
088                startButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
089                        @Override
090                        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
091                                Asteroids.gc.startGame(); // Tell controller to begin game
092                        }
093                });
094                // Set default JButton graphic invisible
095                startButton.setOpaque(false);
096                startButton.setContentAreaFilled(false);
097                startButton.setBorderPainted(false);
098                startButton.setFocusPainted(false);
099                menuPanel.add(startButton, constraints);
100
101                // Set constraints and attributes then add to menu panel
102                constraints.gridx = 0;
103                constraints.gridy = 4;
104                constraints.insets = new Insets(10, 10, 15, 10);
105                JButton exitButton = new JButton(exitButtonImage);
106                exitButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
107                        @Override
108                        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
109                                Asteroids.gc.exitGame(); // Tell controller to begin closing procedures
110                        }
111                });
112                exitButton.setOpaque(false);
113                exitButton.setContentAreaFilled(false);
114                exitButton.setBorderPainted(false);
115                exitButton.setFocusPainted(false);
116                menuPanel.add(exitButton, constraints);
117                
118                this.add(menuPanel); // Add completed menu panel to frame
119                setVisible(true); // Display completed frame
120        }
121
122        /** Setup window to display game 
123        */
124        public void startGame() {
125                gamePanel = new JPanel(); // Initialize JPanel to render game objects
126                gamePanel.setBounds(0, 0, Asteroids.CANVAS_WIDTH, Asteroids.CANVAS_HEIGHT); // Set size to the same as window
127                gamePanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout()); // Use basic border layout
128                gamePanel.setBackground(Color.BLACK); // Set background color
129
130                this.add(gamePanel); // Add game panel to window
131                setVisible(true); // Display soulless black void
132
133                // Setup label to display current score
134                scoreLabel = new JLabel("Score: 0"); // Score should start at zero
135                scoreLabel.setBounds(0, 0, 100, 10); // Set to top left of screen, small and out of the way
136                scoreLabel.setForeground(Color.WHITE); // Set color to white
137                scoreLabel.setFont(new Font("Courier", Font.PLAIN, 14)); // Set font
138                gamePanel.add(scoreLabel); // Add to game panel
139
140                // Setup label to display current lives
141                livesLabel = new JLabel("Lives: 3"); // Lives should start at three
142                livesLabel.setBounds(0, 15, 100, 10); // Set to display under score label
143                livesLabel.setForeground(Color.WHITE);
144                livesLabel.setFont(new Font("Courier", Font.PLAIN, 14));
145                gamePanel.add(livesLabel);
146        }
147
148        /** Adds a component to be drawn on the game panel
149        * This method uses Polymorphism to allow all game objects to be handled by 
150        * one method as they are all descendents of JComponent
151        * @param components An array of components to be added one by one to panel
152        */
153        public void addToPanel(JComponent[] components) {
154                for (JComponent component : components) {
155                        gamePanel.add(component); // Add each component to game panel
156                        gamePanel.validate(); // Validate new panel state after each new component is added
157                }
158        }
159
160        /** Removes a component from the game panel
161        * This method uses Polymorphism to allow all game objects to be handled by 
162        * one method as they are all descendents of JComponent
163        * @param component Component to be removed from panel
164        */
165        public void removeFromPanel(JComponent component) {
166                gamePanel.remove(component); // Remove component from game panel
167                gamePanel.revalidate(); // Validate new panel state after removal
168        }
169
170        /** Updates score label in game
171        * @param score New score to be displayed 
172        */
173        public void updateScore(int score) {
174                scoreLabel.setText("Score: " + score); // Set score label text to display new score
175                gamePanel.revalidate(); // Validate new panel state
176        }
177
178        /** Updates lives label in game
179        * @param lives New lives to be displayed
180        */
181        public void updateLives(int lives) {
182                livesLabel.setText("Lives: " + lives); // Set lives label text to display new lives
183                gamePanel.revalidate(); // Validate new panel state
184        }
185
186        /** Updates game panel to show new state
187        */
188        public void tick() {
189                gamePanel.repaint(); // Panel will update position of all game pieces
190        }
191
192        /** Purges game window to prevent unexpected behavior
193        */
194        public void clearGame() {
195                this.remove(gamePanel); // Remove game panel
196        }
197
198        /** Purges game window to prevent unexpected behavior
199        */
200        public void clearMenu() {
201                this.remove(menuPanel); // Remove menu panel
202        }
203}
